title: Science / Science & Exploration
author: Jonathan M Gitlin
description: Serving the Technologist for more than a decade. IT news, reviews, and analysis.
cleaned_text: Science / Science & Exploration - [No sign of safety risks with longterm pot use for chronic pain](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/no-sign-of-safety-risks-with-long-term-pot-use-for-chronic-pain/) Researchers at McGill in Canada found no serious effects from 2.5g/day. - [Boeing publishes photos of secret 1960s stealth plane experiment](https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2015/09/boeing-publishes-photos-of-secret-1960s-stealth-plane-experiment/) "Quiet Bird" model echoes modern stealth fighters, but it never took wing. - [Supermassive black holes found spiraling in at seven percent light speed](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/supermassive-black-holes-found-spiraling-in-at-seven-percent-light-speed/) The first system found moving so fast has big implications for galaxy evolution. - [Comet 67P gets frosty in the shade](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/comet-67p-gets-frosty-in-the-shade/) Rosetta observations show daily surface ice buildup. - [Musicians hear songs when they read music, non-musicians seek visual patterns](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/musicians-hear-songs-when-they-read-music-non-musicians-seek-visual-patterns/) In some cases, brain training actually changes our brains. - [Science Museum's Cosmonauts: Birth of the Space Age reviewed](https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2015/09/science-museums-cosmonauts-birth-of-the-space-age-reviewed/) The exhibit is a striking testament to the oft-overlooked Soviet space program. - [The particle accelerator that can draw data out of specks of comet dust](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/the-particle-accelerator-that-can-draw-data-out-of-specks-of-comet-dust/) Ars checks out the amazing instrument that has revolutionized geoscience. - [UK wants China to lead the building and operation of British nuclear power stations](https://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2015/09/uk-wants-china-to-lead-the-building-and-operation-of-british-nuclear-power-stations/) £2B guarantee for Hinkley, plus plans for first China-owned nuclear plant in the west. - [Moons of fire and ice: Global oceans in our Solar System](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/moons-of-fire-and-ice-global-oceans-in-our-solar-system/) The molten material in Io and Enceladus appears to encircle these worlds. - [The elite don't hand out resources like the rest of us](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/the-elite-dont-hand-out-resources-like-the-rest-of-us/) Those from premier schools take a very utilitarian approach. - [The iPad and your kid—digital daycare, empowering educator, or something bad?](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/the-ipad-and-your-kid-digital-daycare-empowering-educator-or-something-bad/) Researchers want to find out, but the subject (and related science) is complicated. - [Physicist says band Deerhoof inspires him like Einstein, asks them to rock at LHC](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/physicist-says-band-deerhoof-inspires-him-like-einstein-asks-them-to-rock-at-lhc/) Video: Band "like the best scientists... embraced the unknown with spectacular results." [Signs of neutrinos from the dawn of time, less than a second after the Big Bang](https://arstechnica.com/science/2015/09/signs-of-neutrinos-from-the-dawn-of-time-less-than-a-second-after-the-big-bang/) First unambiguous observation of the cosmic neutrino background.
